title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: Got an 820-2828 with an external display issue. My customer replaced the GPU but couldn't get it to work. I got it and took it apart and reassembled it carefully and it started to work. I gave it back to the customer and they gave it back to their customer. It has been returned for not working. So far I can get an external image via TB but if I turn on with screen it will light up for a few seconds then goes black. The fourth diagnostic LED also turns off. Once it turn off I cannot get it to repeat the fault unless I leave it unplugged for a while. I assume since I get an image externally, the GPU is ok. Any ideas on what to check next? I think I tried to replace the LED driver board before but it didn't change anything.

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: I miss-spoke. I meant to say I have an INTERNAL display problem.

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: I did. Going to try new inverter board next

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: So I put a new inverter board in and it seems to be working, though every once in a while the screen will go black for half a second then come back on. Trying to get password to check temps with HW Monitor

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: Now I turned it off and the screen won't come back on.

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: When I power it back up that is...

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: So VIDEO_ON_L is 3.3V. Going to measure with LCD plugged in to see if it changes

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: VIDEO_ON_L goes from 3.3v to .08v as LCD and 4th LED turns on turns on, then after 10 seconds screen goes off and it goes back high

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message:
VIDEO_ON comes from LCD panel.
DP_INTRNL_HPD goes off too?
You should try another display and flex.

Be sure R9050/51/10 have 0 ohm.

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: all three resistors measure o ohms, DP_INTRNL_HPD stays at 3.3V

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message:
BL_FN must go high at same time with VIDEO_ON.
Check signals when the backlight problem is present.

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: Will check that, tried new LCD and cable to no avail. Thinking about replacing U9000.

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message:
Remove C9005 and try again.
You can even remove U9000 and tie pads 1/4 together...

title: 820-2828 Display issue
message: Didn't see your last post until now. I replaced the LB and still same issue. This narrows it down to three things that have not been replaced by me. The GPU , The Power supply and the actual wiring harness from the power supply to the rest of the computer. I do have the IR sensor unplugged. Would that affect anything?
